definition: An-Shi Rebellion (755-763) of 安祿山|安禄山[An1 Lu4 shan1] and 史思明[Shi3 Si1 ming2], a catastrophic setback for Tang dynasty
surname An
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
surname Shi
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: It typically reflects the tragic fate of literal man of Tang flouring age after Anshi Rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 它典型地反映了盛唐文人在安史之乱后的悲剧命运。

sentences.english: Anshi's Rebellion is the indication of the new epoch to the poetry.
sentences.chinese: 安史之乱对于诗歌来说，标志着一个新时代的开始。

sentences.english: Adds Anlushan Rebellion's reason, causes Tang Dynasty's national strength to decline day after day.
sentences.chinese: 加之安史之乱的原因，使唐朝的国力日渐衰退。

sentences.english: The power of the eunuch had taken place great changes since An-shi Rebellion in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐代宦官的权势经安史之乱发生了重大的变化。

sentences.english: In the Tang Dynasty , An Lushan and Shi Siming led an armed rebellion . Many ministers either surrendered or fled .
sentences.chinese: 唐朝安史之乱期间，许多大臣都投降或者逃跑了。

sentences.english: The phenomenon of renting land between personal is more and more after An Shi Rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 安史之乱后，私人出租和租借土地的现象越来越多。

sentences.english: The An-Shi Rebellion, which broke out in 755 and lasted for 8 years, bought great disasters to the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: “安史之乱”持续了八年，造成巨大的社会灾难。

definition: Huang Chao peasant uprising 875-884 in late Tang, led by Huang Chao
Tang dynasty (618-907)
Emperor Suzong of Tang (711-762), reign name of eighth Tang emperor Li Heng 李亨[Li3 Heng1], reigned 756-762

Emperor Taizong of Tang (727-779), reign name of ninth Tang emperor Li Yu 李豫[Li3 Yu4], reigned 762-779
Emperor Dezong of Tang (742-805), reign name of tenth Tang emperor Li Kuo 李适[Li3 Kuo4], reigned 779-805
rebellion against Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁 in 548
late Tang peasant uprising 875-884 led by Huang Chao
late Tang period (9th century)
last years of the Sui dynasty/early 7th century AD
Sui dynasty (581-617)
Five Dynasties (907-960) and Ten Kingdoms (902-979), period of political turmoil in ancient China
the Tang dynasty (618-907)
Western Jin dynasty (265-316)
Emperor Xizong of Tang, reign name of nineteenth Tang Emperor Li Xuan 李儇[Li3 Xuan1] (862-888), reigned 873-888
Emperor Wuzong of Tang (814-846), reign name of sixteenth Tang emperor Li Chan 李瀍[Li3 Chan2], reigned 840-846
